etymology.description: Pictogram: animal paw with spread toes (Shuowen; cf. 蹯); alt. view: wooden plough 力 scattering seeds to mean “disseminate” (cf. 播). Unrelated to the top of 𢍏 (in 奧).
etymology.interpretation: One tradition sees a splayed paw, evoking the idea of spreading apart and thus distinguishing. Another reads the graph as a plough scattering seeds, which also suggests spreading and differentiation. Similarity to the component atop 𢍏/奧 is accidental and historically unrelated.

examples.chinese: 学者善于分辨真假(學者善於分辨真假)。
examples.english: Scholars are good at distinguishing truth from falsehood.
